item.title: Trade Me-1-API testing first demo
item.description:
Foreword

Why I write this series? Three reasons.

  • 1st, the background is the author was in the process of seeking testing job in New Zealand. To pick a proper product and use the main stream testing tools to cover the manual testing, API automation testing, UI automation testing, and CICD will be a smart work for the author to show what his ability.
  • 2nd, the author found that too many testing engineers surrounding him expressed the desire to learn some automated testing techniques. But they don’t know what’s the roadmap to extend their testing technique stack, where to start with, and how to practice such comprehensive skills in as little time as possible? So, the author thought that such a series might help himself meanwhile to help those people who have the above questions in mind.
  • 3rd, the author wants to use this platform to get instant feedback to correct his own misconceptions about IT technologies, ultimately improving IT knowledge accumulation efficiency for both author and learner.

item.title: Trade Me-2-typical transactions
item.description:
How to pick the typical transactions?

Before coding the API test script, we need to pick some typical transactions from TradeMe.

And these transactions we’ve picked better to cover different types of requests, such as the get, post, delete.

And part of these transactions should correlate with each other at the business level.

item.title: Trade Me-13-scenarios-and-newman-reports
item.description:
Scenario‘s position in the API automation testing

Typical transactions selection -> Corresponding API selection -> Scripting -> Scenarios and reports(I’m here) -> CICD
